utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It’s nice to get back to nature. Why don’t I do this more often? What a beautiful forest. Hello, little butterfly. What’s your Na-oh!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Whatcha doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was enjoying some virtual reality, until you ruined it with your actual face.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What am I smelling?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, it’s car air freshener. I was simulating the smell of the forest.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: That’s not what the forest smells like.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, how would I know?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why are you pretending to be outdoors? You hate it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm? Oh. Amy showed me a compelling study that demonstrated the cognitive benefit of spending time in the wilderness.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Buddy, I am ready to drive you into the wilderness any time you want and leave you there.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, make your jokes, but some of the participants who spent four days in the woods away from all technology reported a fifty percent gain in reasoning skills upon their return.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, if that’s true, why aren’t there more genius squirrels?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You may need this more than I do.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Here’s your tea.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. Do not sneak up on a guy when he’s sitting on a log.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, if you really want to be in nature, why don’t we rent a cabin?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Look, I’m sorry, when did you even get here? I…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, there’s a cabin in Big Bear that a doctor I work with keeps offering me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because he’s hitting on you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: She.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, good.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: But I could get her.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We could all go for the weekend. It’ll be fun.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me. Here, look up fun, get back to me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You and I could still go and have a nice weekend.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Come on, Sheldon, let’s go with them.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I hardly think so. You be sure and say hello to all the mosquitoes, bees, bears, snakes, possums, poison oak, oh, and last, but not least, teenagers with guitars.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’ll see if it’s available.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, if that study’s real, Leonard might come back smarter than you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you trying to manipulate me?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well done, it worked, we’re going.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Yay.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Come on, Raj, give me a bag.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, no, you’re pregnant. The only thing you carry is our hope for a better tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, where you been?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Uh, Raj took me to the baby doctor and then we swung by the grocery store.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Did you get graham crackers? I mean, are, wuh, is the baby okay?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yes and yes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I didn’t know you needed help running errands today.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I didn’t, but Raj volunteered.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, ever since you told him I was pregnant, he’s really been making a fuss over me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh. Well, I guess that’s kind of sweet.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Bernie, I just forwarded you a list of the top five lactation consultants in Los Angeles. I know my favourite, but I’d love to hear what you think.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And it just got weird.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey. Amy’s downstairs.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, one sec.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Uh, what, what you got goin’ on here?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I bought a baseball cap.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I can see that. What team did you get?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, Hufflepuff, from Harry Potter.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, we’ll be in the woods.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m ready to go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Anything you’d like to say to him?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Nice hat, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why are you so mean to me?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What the hell are you watching?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Raj found all these childbirth videos online. This one is of a woman giving birth in a river.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Okay, that is the least Jewish thing I’ve ever seen in my life. You feel like Raj is getting a little carried away with all the baby stuff?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I don’t think so. He just wants to be part of the experience.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, if you say so. What’s in the box?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, it’s an ultrasonic microphone so we can hear the baby’s heartbeat.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh. That’s cool. Can we try it?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Actually, Raj ordered it. He made me promise to wait till he was here.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So he can be part of the experience?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m surprised he let us conceive without him.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It’s a sore spot, don’t bring it up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s so cute and rustic up here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know. Did you see they still have a video rental place? it’s like Colonial Williamsburg.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, cell service is down to one bar, so if anyone needs medical attention or to tell a stranger their political views are stupid, now’s the time.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Have you ever been off the grid before?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Once. The battery ran out on my phone. I had to wait for my iPad to turn on.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I was afraid he was gonna eat me.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Raj just pulled up. I’m gonna say something to him.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Leave it alone. He means well.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: So you don’t think he needs to rein it in a little?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No, not really.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: And you’re not concerned he’s acting like somehow this is his kid, too?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: He’s just trying to be supportive.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Just supportive. Not over-the-top in any way?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You saw him carrying that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Astronauts saw him carrying that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: This place is great.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So nice of that doctor to just let you use it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, she is taking me to an Indigo Girls concert, so hold that thought.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Okay. Well, shall we check each other for ticks?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, all we did was walk in from the car.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. Well, suit yourself. Who wants to check me?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: On the other hand, safety first.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Wow, it’s really coming down.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: This sucks.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And there goes our hike.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, not our hike, now we have to stay safe and warm.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, we could still go. A little rain isn’t gonna kill us.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Have you been outside in the rain with Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You’ll wish it would kill you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So what do we do now?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They have some board games.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Eh, most of the Jenga pieces are missing and the Scrabble only has seven tiles, so unless you want to build an unimpressive structure with the word shnerpf next to it, move on.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, let’s light a fire.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Ooh, that sounds cozy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t think I’ve lit a real fire before.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ah, it’s basic thermodynamics. I’m sure we can figure that out.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I could stack the logs conically to facilitate airflow.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That would maximize oxygen for optimal combustion.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Right. So all we need is to…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A scientist made that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Look, Raj, you’re my best friend in the world and I really appreciate your enthusiasm about the baby.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Please, my pleasure.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And, of course, Howie and I both want you to be a part of all this.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: But we have to set some boundaries.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t understand.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: The three of us aren’t having this baby. Just the two of us.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh. Okay. Yeah, I get it. I’ll back off.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Thanks for understanding.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Of course. I’ll give you guys some space. Let me just get this out of your way.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You need some help?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: No, I got it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Raj, Raj, wait.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Please, Bernadette. Let me leave with my dignity.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, you guys want to play a drinking game?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, well now, we’ll never win. You always play the drinking game.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Not the drinking game, a drinking game.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: To be fair, good at both.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What’s the game?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, it’s called Never Have I Ever. The rules are simple. Someone says something they’ve never done, but if you have done it, you take a drink.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ve never played that before.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hey, now, wait. Have we started? Do I drink? What is happening?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Calm down. I’ll go first. All right, let’s see. Never have I ever…

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: She’s trying to think of something she’s never done before. This could take a while.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Very funny. Okay, never have I ever… yeah, you know what? Let’s just circle back.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, I’ll go. Never have I ever been arrested.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So I drink.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, it’s only if you’ve done it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Got it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I can’t believe you’ve been arrested.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can’t believe Penny hasn’t.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, what did you do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I’m not proud of it, but I jaywalked.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, no, it’s like a horror movie. We’re trapped in a cabin with a maniac.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m surprised you would do that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, I crossed in the middle of the street. And normally, I wouldn’t, but I saw an aggressive-looking Girl Scout, and it was the heart of cookie season. Anyway, there was a police officer, and he witnessed the whole thing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What, he arrested you for that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, he didn’t do anything. So I said, you just saw me jaywalk, why aren’t you doing your job? You know? May, maybe I should arrest you for, for impersonating a police officer.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And then you got arrested.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, and how.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I feel like I just made a horrible mistake.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: But on the other hand, I didn’t kick him out of our lives. I just asked him to back off a little.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What? Are you gonna cry?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Is it baby hormones or actually sad?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I can’t tell anymore.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’ll go get him.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And bring back the bear.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: This game’s dangerous. I could get you in trouble.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, never have I ever used Sheldon’s toothbrush to clean the sink.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Fine, is that how you want to play this? All right, never have I ever come up with a nickname for my own genitals.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Never should’ve told you about Alvin and the Chipmunks.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay. My turn. Um, never have I ever completely rocked my girlfriend’s world in bed.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know the rules. Drink.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, go ahead.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s right.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right, my turn. Mm. Oh, I know. Never have I ever kept a secret bank account, because I think my wife can’t handle money. Did I win? I feel like I won.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I can’t believe this. You realize I make more money than you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t, I know, but this isn’t a big deal. It’s just a little savings I put aside.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We’re married. We’re supposed to share everything.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What, you mean, like, your massive credit card debt?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m calling it. I won.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I appreciate the apology, but it’s really not necessary. I overstepped my bounds.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, Raj, you’ve been great. I just, I need to start doing my part around here.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I hear that.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, if that’s the case, is there anything I can do to help?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, not right now. But we could try out that microphone you got us, and listen to the baby’s heartbeat.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Really? It’s okay if I listen with you?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Can I squirt the ultrasound jelly on your stomach?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, look at that. It’s weird again.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, you have every right to be mad. And what you said is true. You do make more money than me. So I had no right to do what I did. And I’m so sorry. I hope you can forgive me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How long have you had this secret account?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: A couple years, but I just put a few bucks aside every month for emergencies.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, how much you got in there?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Six thousand four hundred and twenty seven dollars. Forty seven dollars once my nana’s birthday check gets here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: My God, Leonard, do you know what I could do with that kind of money?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, I do, and that’s why I hid it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What good is it if you don’t use it?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, you have shoes you love, but never wear. I have money I love, but never spend. We’re kind of a cute couple that way. Again, I’m sorry. I shouldn’t have kept it a secret.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I have a secret I’ve been keeping from you, too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Is it a secret bank account? Because that would be awesome.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I hate my job.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really? Why?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Because I don’t feel good flirting with doctors for sales. I mean, I know I make a lot of money. But I haven’t been happy for a while.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why didn’t you tell me?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Because I know how important it is to you that I’m having some success.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s not true.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, really? So you’d be fine if I went back to acting and waiting tables again?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: If that’s what you want to do, yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, it’s not what I want to do.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Doesn’t matter what I want. Look, this job is gonna get me out of debt. So I’m gonna do the grown-up thing and see it through.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, that is the grown-up thing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I guess.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I love you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I love you, too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know, never have I ever made love in the forest while it was raining.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, guess I gotta drink.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, here we go.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m not hearing anything.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, give me a second.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you sure you can do this?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, who found four dollars and change on the beach with his metal detector?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I buried it there, so we could go home.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Wait, that’s it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Isn’t that the best?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You guys made a person.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We did.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And I like to think I helped.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, never have I ever drunk milk past its expiration date.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Never have I ever cancelled a dentist appointment.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, uh, never have I ever put my foot in the ocean.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Never have I ever honked if I liked anything.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, uh, never have I ever thrown, caught or touched a Frisbee.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Never have I ever put salt on my food without trying it first.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh. Never have I ever pushed all the buttons in an elevator.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, we all have a past.
